meanings.definition: The act of thrusting out or forcing something outwards.
meanings.sent1: The detrusion of the balloon startled the cat.
meanings.sent2: I noticed a detrusion in the wall where the paint was peeling.
meanings.sent3: The detrusion of the cake from the oven was a surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her detrusion of emotions overwhelmed her.
meanings.sent5: The detrusion of the tree roots made the sidewalk uneven.

meanings.definition: Something that protrudes or sticks out.
meanings.sent1: The small detrusion on the rock caught my attention.
meanings.sent2: The detrusion on the car door made it difficult to close.
meanings.sent3: The detrusion of the toy from the box was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The detrusion of the mountain peak against the sky was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The detrusion of the flower petals added beauty to the garden.

meanings.definition: The state of being pushed or projected outward.
meanings.sent1: The detrusion of the crowd made it hard to move forward.
meanings.sent2: I felt the detrusion of the wind against my face.
meanings.sent3: The detrusion of the bubble gum was comical.
meanings.sent4: Her detrusion of energy was contagious.
meanings.sent5: The detrusion of the waves against the shore was powerful.
